item.title: Whats in a Word
item.description: image source 1 A. example of chiari malformation (white arrow) and syringomelia (blue arrow) on T2-weighted MRI sequence pre-surgery and B. post surgery What’s in a word?2 You’ll certainly get a different answer depending on whom you ask. One point that experts and amateurs can all appreciate though is the fact that the words we utter on a daily basis have entire histories behind them; they are imbued with stories of their creation, their itineration, and their evolution.
